runs.comm: inside edge to begins with. This one seams in from outside off, the bottom edge goes to fine leg for one
length ball on the pads, Dilshan misses out. Gets a leg-bye, though
on the pads, worked away square of fine leg
short and wide, Sanga moves across to get close to the line, and blasts this cut shot away
short and wide again, this time Sanga lets it go through
wide, big wide outside off

Missed run-out. Short of a length, pushed to midwicket, Sanga starts running, then sends Dilshan back. He is not even in the frame. He has given up, but Latif's throw doesn't hit the stumps, and Tanvir couldn't have gone back that fast
length ball, outside off, defended back
lashes at this widish delivery, misses it by a country mile
short of a length, into the pads, worked to square leg
short of a length, outside off, in Dilshan zone, and he punches it powerfully past point. He doesn't need much room to do this to bowlers
short and wide, Dilshan doesn't need second invitations. Slashes it over point for an easy boundary
short again, punched hard again, but finds cover-point this time
full and wide, Sanga drives at it, playing the shot outside the line of it. He dragged on a similar delivery the other night
length ball, into the pads, worked away to deep square
short of a length, within the stumps, pushed to cover
short, seams away, beats the edge as Dilshan cuts half-heartedly
length ball, on leg, angling towards off, Dilshan looks to whip this to leg, gets a leading edge to cover, along the ground
short of a length, on off, angles away, left alone
wide down the leg side. Ordinary start from Arafat
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover

Arafat gets the wicket. For no obvious reason, Sangakkara - who has the run-rate under control - dances down the track and slashes at the fast bowler. Mis-hits it straight to point, and Pakistan are still in it
wild heave-ho from Kula first ball. Misses by a foot. There is no need for this
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover-point
bouncer, Kula shapes up to pull, then sees it is too high to control, and withdraws from the shot

Sri Lanka have let Pakistan back in through some ordinary batting and inexplicable thinking. Promoted to No. 3, Kulasekara plays three dots before going for another wild hit, and manages to lob it as far as cover-point. T20 doesn't follow reason or logic
lovely delivery, angling in, then leaving him after pitching. Beaten comprehensively
this one comes in with the angle, hits him on the pads. Too sharp for Kapu
full this time, driven nicely, but can't beat extra cover
length ball on off, driven nicely, along the ground, to mid-off
short, Kapugedara transfers the weight well, and pulls this through midwicket to get off the mark
short of a length, on the pads, pushed for an easy single into the on side
short of a length, into the body, worked away for a single
length ball into the pads, worked away to midwicket
bouncer, sits up for him, and Dilshan pulls this away through square leg for four. well on top of it
wide down the leg side
short of a length, on the stumps, pushed back to him
slower ball, turns out to be a full toss, worked away to deep square leg
short of a length, within the stumps, defended to leg
length ball, on off, pushed wide of cover for one
big wide down the leg side. Misses the line completely
short of a length, outside off, chest high, pushed to cover
angling into the pads, worked away for a single
what a delivery... 146ks, short of a length, and it hurries up. Dilshan is about a second late into the shot. That ball was something
length ball, accurate again, Dilshan pushes to cover
nicely played. Dilshan uses Sami's pace. Quick delivery again, 143ks, just outside off, Dilshan arches back to make room, and guides it through the vacant slip region
huge lbw appeal first ball, beats him with a non-turner but this is headed down leg
even bigger appeal this time, they are putting the umpire under pressure, but again this is a non-turner headed down leg
shortish outside off, punched to sweeper-cover for one
huge huge appeal. No turn again. This one is much closer than the previous ones. Pitched on a length, in front of off, angling in, hits him in front of leg. Umpire suggests a nick here

Sahibzada Mohammad Shahid Khan Afridi doesn't need the umpire this time. No turn again. No room again. A frustrated Dilshan goes to cut a ball that is neither short nor wide. Cleaned up. And Afridi raises his arms in the Boris Becker celebration
flighted on the pads, worked to the right of deep square leg, comes back for two
tossed up, offbreak, defended to cover
doosra. He hasn't read it at all. Snicks the thigh on the way through
sharp offbreak, defended to square leg
fired down leg, and he reverse-sweeps it for a single
flighted, middle and leg, worked away to deep square leg for one
flighted nicely, middle and off, defended off the front foot
pushed back to Afridi
bottom edge. Into the pads of the keeper. You can't go cutting Afridi, which is what he did here
fast and straight, pushed back to him
much slower legbreak this time, Chandimal bunts it into the leg side and wants a couple. Kapu is slow when turning back, but just about makes it as the third-umpire replays show
quick, outside off, pushed to point
flighted, middle and leg, Chandimal plays a nice little paddle for three
flighted on middle and off, driven down to long-off for one
doosra, Kapu stays back to open the face and get a single to deep point
sharp offbreak, worked to square leg
drops this one short, Chandimal goes back, and hits this down to long-off for one
fuller, quick delivery. No turn. Defended back to him
Kapu gambles, and wins. flighted delivery outside off, he plays the reverse sweep, past short third man, all along the ground
Clean strike. Slog sweep to a full delivery outside off. Sweet connection, well over long-on
and Afridi has his right index finger up in the air as his team-mates gather around him. He has fired this slider in, and before Kapu realises it has crashed through the gate to flatten the stumps
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
slower, short of a length, defended back to him
the non-turner again, Thirimanne looks to work to leg, gets a leading edge through point for a single
four first ball. Lovely shot. Full outside ff, he goes inside-out, wide of extra cover, and Arafat misfields in the deep
flatter, shorter, worked into the leg side
flat, outside off, cut away to deep point for one
length ball on off, pushed to straight extra cover
lovely shot again from Thirimanne. Flighted outside off, and he goes inside-out again, past extra cover, along the ground
full and flat, driven to long-on to make it 11 from the over

Afridi has a parallel game going on with the umpire too. Fourth huge lbw shout in four overs. This one has pitched outside off, but is turning in, and and is angling too. Hence given not-out, but the appeal never ends
turning in, pushed to straight midwicket
driven to long-on this time
slower, higher, defended to cover
looks to cut Afridi. Risky shot. manages to make a connection, but plays it straight to point
slows it down now, 87ks, gets the edge, but it falls well short of point. Top spell from Afridi: 2 for 17 in his quota, to go with the fifty that kept the contest alive
slower ball first up. Nearly done in, but the push doesn't carry back to Tanvir
quicker one now. Not so much the speed, but the bounce. Sharp. And beats his cut by at least six inches
slower ball again, pushed to deep point for one
slips in the bouncer, beats Chandimal's slash. Pressure mounting
Tanvir strikes timber. Too much pressure. Slower ball. Chandimal tries the scoop over the keeper. He is through the shot before the ball arrives. When it does arrive, the ball hits the leg stump
short of a length, cramps him up, pushed back to Tanvir
bottom edge as Thirimanne looks to cut, but he will take the single to short fine leg
short of a length, punched wide of long-on for two
quicker toppie, bounces rib high for him. Mathews rides the bounce, and gets a single to deep square
nice back-foot drive, past point, comes back for two. Stayed back for it, and then opened the face at the right time
flat offbreak, on off, defended to cover
Thirimanne makes room, Ajmal follows him, Thiri dinks this into the leg side, and wants a couple. It's a tight second, and Mathews would have been out with a direct hit. They make it, though
quick, on off, no room, pushed for a single to cover

he has done Thirimanne in for pace here. Sami copped a lot of flak the other night, but Sami has come back superbly. Not too short, but this bounces chest high, with no room. And then the pace. To late into the pull. Keeper completes an easy catch
pace like fiyah maan... Short of a length, kisses off the pitch, and beats Perera's attempt to dab at it. Late into the shot again - 143ks here
what has Sami done here? A Test-match wide. Full and way down the leg side. No chance for the keeper either. Sami gets the towel out. Dew or sweat?

you can't keep a really quick man down for to long. Good to see real raw pace in a format where "taking the pace off" is the regulation delivery. Sami is quick, straight, just short of a length, and has burst through Perera's defences. Timbahhhh. Boy, is Sami pumped?
they can't lay bat on ball here. Beaten for pace again. And did a see a hint of backing away by the batsman? Short of a length, outside off, and the ball has beaten him even before the bat comes down

seriously fast again, and this is kissing the surface and bouncing away. Tennis-ball bounce? That is happening in Paris. Short of a length, bounces well over his bat, and is collected throat high by the keeper. Lovely over
straighter delivery outside off, punched to deep point for a single

Don't bother about the dots. Ajmal gets a wicket. Reminiscent of Tino "mind-the-windows" Best. Kaushal leaves the crease even before the ball is delivered, and all Ajmal has to do is bowl the straighter delivery, and he is stumped by miles
another straighter one, and this is like Persian for tailenders: they can't read it
quick sharp offbreak now, hits his pad
finally bat on ball, worked around the corner for one
drives at a length ball, the thick edge gets him a single to third man
Sami is running through them here. A poor shot. He is looking to sweep Sami, and this is a length ball well wide of him. The top edge is gleefully accepted at cover
backing away to make room, pushes this to deep point for one, and Mathews is off strike again
fast, just outside off, tailender backing away, beaten
yorker, that's too good... at that pace. Dug out for a single to mid-off
full and straight, pushed to straight extra for a single
Mathews makes room to smash this down the ground, and Akmal makes a diving save at long-on to keep them down to two

fittingly Afridi gets the last touch on the ball. This is his 50th T20I, and he has scored a fifty, taken wickets, and then the final catch. Mathews slices this slog towards long-off, and Afridi charges in to complete a low catch. Hafeez is delighted at first win as captain
